page.title: 14NEWLANDS FARM,RAMSGATE
page.content: Newlands farm is owned by St.Lawrence College and rented from them by Mr.Ash .His family have been tenants since 1943.The farm covers an area of 70 acres and is one of four worked by Mr. Ash and his brother.There are no animals apart from a guard dog.He grows 5 crops on a 4-year rotation:- wheat/wheat/early potatoes/cauliflower for early cutting/cauliflower for cutting after Christmas.The early potatoes and cauliflowers are sent to London to be sold whilst the late crops are packed and sold locally. People from the nearby estate have been known to steal or vandalise certain crops.The farms employ 25 people full time and up to 100 part time at harvest time.Some of the farm buildings are very old especially the tithe barn which is the largest in Kent.
